course.subject: PHYS
course.name: Physical Phenomena in Everyday Life
course.description: For non-Physics students only. Why can't we see stars at daytime? Why does toast land jelly-side down? Why doesn't a bicycle fall? These phenomena, which we observe in everyday life, are all governed by the laws of Physics. In this course, we shall explore how the basic laws of physics work in our everyday life with simple examples and demonstrations.
course.exclusions: A passing grade in AL Physics
